intro: Vahea crassipes, commonly known as the broad-leaved vahea, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, yellow flowers. It typically grows in coastal areas and thrives in sandy or rocky soils. Vahea crassipes plays a role in local ecosystems and is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes.
